pr_title: Adding diagnostic log collection feature to integration tests

timeline.message: Adding diagnostic features to integration test
changed the implementation to use LifecycleMethodExecutionExceptionHandler

timeline.bodyText:
The above tagging won't be necessary if the decision is to use LogginUtil.getNSListIntersecting( )
Please add your review comments as to which way to use to get the namespace list.
timeline.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: this is not what i was looking for, let's discuss at the daily meeting
replies.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: Implemented the new method of creating namespaces based on the Annotation at the method parameter. The TestWatcher creates it and passes it to the test method for use. The list is can be used for log collection and can be used for cleanup once the test is done.

timeline.message: changed the implmentation for namespace collectioin
Fix for the empty namespace list
Get domain object lists using CustomObjectsApi

timeline.bodyText: numofns is kind of cryptic.  Is there a reason not to make this more verbose?
timeline.author: ddsharpe

replies.bodyText: Just wanted to keep the name shorter. Is "namespacesRequired" is good enough ?
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: can't it just be Namespaces(2) ?
replies.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText:
Removed the annotation at class level and moved it to method parameter per Derek's comments.
Also renamed it as Namespaces with default field. So method signature can use Namespaces(2)
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.author: ddsharpe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,19 +39,23 @@
 
 @DisplayName("Simple validation of basic domain functions")
 @IntegrationTest
+//Every test class needs to tagged with this annotation for log collection and namespace creation.
+@ExtendWith(IntegrationTestWatcher.class)
+// The ITNamespaces numofns value is used to create the number of unique namespaces needed by the test.
+// The namespace list is available for use by all methods in the test class.
+@ITNamespaces(numofns = 1) //

replies.bodyText:
Yes we can do this. Lets see what others think.
A minor thing is, it has to be placed at every method that wants to create new namespaces.
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText: maybe we should just have a single extension - are there example of when we would would want one of these but not the other @ddsharpe @rjeberhard? i can't think of any
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText:
Removed the Timing extension and moved the @ExtendWith(IntegrationTestWatcher.class)  from test class to IntegrationTest interface.
The IntegrationTestWatcher implements methods that were in Timing.java

@@ -216,18 +258,24 @@ public static String getPodLog(String name, String namespace) throws ApiExceptio
    */
   public static String getPodLog(String name, String namespace, String container)
       throws ApiException {
-    String log = coreV1Api.readNamespacedPodLog(
-        name, // name of the Pod
-        namespace, // name of the Namespace
-        container, // container for which to stream logs
-        null, //  true/false Follow the log stream of the pod
-        null, // number of bytes to read from the server before terminating the log output
-        PRETTY, // pretty print output
-        null, // true/false, Return previous terminated container logs
-        null, // relative time (seconds) before the current time from which to show logs
-        null, // number of lines from the end of the logs to show
-        null // true/false, add timestamp at the beginning of every line of log output
-    );
+    String log = null;
+    try {
+      log = coreV1Api.readNamespacedPodLog(
+          name, // name of the Pod
+          namespace, // name of the Namespace
+          container, // container for which to stream logs
+          null, //  true/false Follow the log stream of the pod
+          null, // number of bytes to read from the server before terminating the log output
+          PRETTY, // pretty print output
+          null, // true/false, Return previous terminated container logs

replies.bodyText: Yes it lists persistent volume claims in all namespaces. I also added another overloaded method to handle namespace specific list.
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: Let's call it listPersistentVolumeClaimsAllNamespaces() then.  Also, why would we ever need this as the diagnostics should be per-namespace.
replies.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: changed the name to listPersistentVolumeClaimsAllNamespaces. I added this method when we need to query all namespaces in the cluster in case needed.

replies.bodyText: Actually, looks like we're using both kinds of API's.  It doesn't really matter.
replies.author: rjeberhard

timeline.bodyText: Why default to 0 instead of 1?  Wouldn't zero be when the annotation is not used.
timeline.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: I wanted the test developers to get used to mentioning the number of namespaces they require. If no values I don't know what this annotation means.( at least for me)
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText: We need some way to label PV's.  This will generate a lot of data since it will grab all PV's, including those associated with domains from other tests.
timeline.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: Maybe just grab PV's associated with PVC's we have in the namespace?
replies.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: Grabbing the weblogic.domainUID value from PVC and using that to list PVs.
